{{Nurse Infobox |image = x-.jpg |name = Kate |status = Alive |alias = Soccer Mom |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]] |last appearance = [[State of Love and Trust]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Kate Anthony]] }} '''Nurse Kate''' is a nurse at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who previously worked at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. When Yumi Miyazaki disappeared from her room, Alex asked Kate about it and she said she'd left with [[Kamaji|her friend]], unaware that Yumi hadn't been discharged because they were short-staffed. ''("[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]]")'' During the nurses' strike, while the nurses was celebrating at the bar, Kate poured a drink on [[Cristina Yang]] and started a fight, which [[Joe]] broke up. ''("[[Break on Through]]")'' When they had a cluster of four surgical deaths in a single morning, surgeons kept canceling their elective surgeries, hoping to avoid bad outcomes. Richard then told Kate that no one was allowed to cancel any more surgeries unless they talked to him first. ''("[[Superstition]]")'' When Adam Morris had an aortic dissection in a trauma room, Kate informed Richard Webber that Dr. Harrison was the cardiothoracic surgeon on call, but he was in surgery. ''("[[Oh, the Guilt]]")'' When Burke was called away from [[Janelle Duco]] to operate on Larry Dickerson, It took longer than he expected and he sent Kate to tell Cristina that he'd be back soon and not to worry. ''("[[Staring at the Sun]]")'' When Ellis went into SVT, Kate informed [[Cristina Yang]] and then went to get Burke. ''("[[Wishin' and Hopin']]")'' Kate asked Cristina about Kramer, a patient of hers. His x-rays were done, but she needed further instructions, which Cristina gave. She also mentioned having checked on Ellis, whom she said was sedate. ''("[[Drowning on Dry Land]]")'' When [[Rebecca Pope|the ferry crash Jane Doe]] had had a facial reconstruction, they put out pictures of her new face, hoping to find her family. Kate came to inform Addison that the police had found a possible match. ''("[[Time After Time]]")'' Kate informed Cristina that her intern, Lexie, had called a code blue on a patient who wasn't code blue. ''("[[Crash Into Me, Part ]]")'' When the hospital was flooding, Kate informed Erica that the Chief had shut down all the ORs except hers and one other. ''("[[Here Comes the Flood]]")'' When Rob Harmon became unstable in his surgery, Kate had to tell Lexie about it while she was with Rob's wife, [[Jen Harmon|Jen]]. ''("[[Beat Your Heart Out]]")'' When Archer was brought to Seattle, Kate was on his case. She was caught between Addison and Derek they fought over his treatment. When Derek won, she administered the drugs he ordered. ''("[[Before and After]]")'' When [[Leslie Wilson]] woke up during her surgery, Kate came to get Derek to handle the situation. ''("[[State of Love and Trust]]")'' Kate is a floor nurse at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]. *Kate has been credited as Nurse and GI Nurse. '''Omar Toussant''' was the husband of [[Giselle Toussant]]. He was in isolation by the IDC after being exposed to the plague.



At some point, Omar and his wife were exposed to someone with the plague.


When he first came into the hospital, he was in the ER with his wife [[Giselle Toussant]] after they were in a car accident on the way to the hospital for what they thought was the flu. As he was talking to the doctors, he felt very sick and was admitted, then soon ended up in isolation. After being in isloation for a few hours, he met [[Miranda Bailey]], who waited with him. Soon after, he had asked if his wife was okay and then Dr. Bailey told him that his wife was in contact with the plague and that created complications. After she told him that his wife did not make it, he started having a panic attack. Dr. Bailey told him to press his hands against her hands on the window of his room and breathe with her, which helped him calm down.



He was married to [[Giselle Toussant]] until her death.

{{Attending Infobox
|image = x-.jpg
|name = Paul Stadler
|died = ; [[Seattle]], Washington
|status = Deceased
|title = M.D., Ph.D., [[Fellow of the American College of Surgeons|F.A.C.S.]]
|marital = *[[Jo Wilson]] ''(wife; separated)''
*[[Jenny (Season )|Jenny]] ''(ex-fianc\uee)''
|job = [[Attending]] [[General Surgery|General Surgeon]]
|workplace = Orlando Medical
|first appearance = [[True Colors (Grey's Anatomy)|True Colors]]
|last appearance = [[Personal Jesus]]
|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]] and [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Matthew Morrison]]
}}'''Paul Stadler''' was Jo's estranged, abusive husband as well as a praised [[General Surgery|general surgeon]] in the medical field.



Paul was attending the Minimally Invasive Surgery Conference in Los Angeles, California. Unbeknownst to him, he was followed throughout the day by Alex Karev. At the end of the day, he went to get in a cab and passed Alex. He offered to split the cab to the airport with Alex, thinking he might have stolen it, but Alex said he could have it. ''("[[True Colors (Grey's Anatomy)|True Colors]]")''


Paul showed up in the middle of the chaos caused by hospital hack at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] and confronted Jo, revealing he also found out her fake name. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")''

Paul acted like he was happy to see Jo and that he was glad she was doing well. He introduced her to his fianc\uee, [[Jenny (Season )|Jenny]], whom he couldn't marry until he and Jo divorced. They sat down to sign the divorce papers, with Meredith present so Jo wouldn't be alone with him. After the papers were signed, Meredith took them and Paul went to leave. However, Jo saw Jenny and used Arizona and Meredith to distract Paul away from Jenny while she talked to Jenny about her relationship with Paul. Jenny denied any abuse and refused Jo's offer to help, though Jo gave her her card with her cell phone number on the back. Paul went back to Jo and told her that Jenny told him what she'd said and that Jenny wouldn't need her number, but he decided he'd keep it for himself. ''("[[---]]")''


Paul later came back into the hospital after being the victim of a hit-and-run. ''("[[---]]")''

At the hospital, he was taken for a CT, which showed a concussion. He was awake and alert, so he asked to be released from the hospital, against Amelia's medical advice. He also tried to convince Jenny to get his stuff and go with him. When she declined, he tried to get out of bed to attack her, but hit his head on the bed frame and then the floor, causing second-impact syndrome, which led to his brain swelling. He was pronounced brain dead and, wanting something good to come from it, Jo decided to donate his organs for transplant. ''("[[Personal Jesus]]")''



[[Jo Wilson]]
He was married to [[Jo Wilson]]. During their relationship, he was extremely abusive toward her. One incident left Jo with a broken rib and an almost ruptured kidney. Eventually, she left him and started a new life with a new name. Years later, he found out about her new identity and that she moved to Seattle and became a doctor at Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital. He then went there and confronted her. ''("[[Out of Nowhere]]")''

While he was at the hospital, he and Jo signed the divorce papers. ''("[[---]]")''

Since the papers weren't filed before his death, Jo was tasked with making his end-of-life decisions, which she used to have his organs donated. ''("[[Personal Jesus]]")''

[[Jenny (Season )|Jenny]]
He was engaged to Jenny. She accompanied him to the hospital when he came to see Jo and sign the divorce papers. Jenny denied that Paul was abusive and declined any help from Jo. ''("[[---]]")''

However, Jenny later admitted to him abusing her and when he asked her to get his stuff, she declined, causing him to try to attack her, but he hit his head, which caused brain death. ''("[[Personal Jesus]]")''


Paul Stadler was a [[General Surgery|general surgeon]] at Orlando Medical with a focus on abdominal surgery and fiber optics. The combination of the two is said to have forged the way for an almost new specialty in surgery. He gave a speech called New Approaches to Antibiotic Resistant Pathogens at the Minimally Invasive Surgery Conference in Los Angeles, California. Arizona cherished his work.


*He went to [[Johns Hopkins Medical School]].<ref>[[True Colors (Grey's Anatomy)|True Colors]], x</ref>
*[[Arizona Robbins]] was a fan of his before learning what he'd done to Jo.<ref>[[---]], x</ref>
*He'd been a doctor for over  years.<ref>[[---]], x</ref>
*He didn't eat red meat, drink, or smoke.<ref>[[Personal Jesus]], x</ref>
*He ran five miles every day.<ref>[[Personal Jesus]], x</ref>

'''Pete Willoughby''' is a police officer who came into the ER with a gunshot wound.


Pete was in his first month on the job as a police officer when he was shot in the chest. He came into the ER, where he was quickly transferred to surgery.

While he was being moved to another floor, the power went out in the hospital, stopping the elevator, trapping him with George and Alex. Pete's conditioned worsened while they were in the elevator, but there was nothing they could do without medical instruments. The maintenance crew was only able to move the elevator doors a few inches. Pete started hallucinating and his condition declined, so they had to pass instruments through the gap and talk George and Alex through a procedure to stabilize him. Alex froze when offered a scalpel, so George took over and cross-clamped the aorta and then plugged the hole in Pete's heart until they were able to restore open the elevator and move him to surgery.


Pete is a police officer. During his first month on the job, he was shot in the chest when he froze after a perp pulled a gun.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

{{Patient Infobox |image = Petey.png |name = Petey |status = Unknown |alias = Psycho Crazy Dude |diagnosis = Gunshot Wound |doctors = [[Cristina Yang]] |treatment = Surgery |marital = Spouse |children = At least one child |workplace = '''Former'''
Restaurant |only appearance = [[Deterioration of the Fight or Flight Response]] |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] }} '''Petey''' is the name of a former restaurant employee who came back to shoot his former boss at the restaurant and later at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. Petey was fired from his job at a Seattle restaurant. Shortly after this, he returned to his place of work armed with a gun and began to shoot. He injured and killed before fleeing. He escaped and was at large until he came to the hospital where his victims had been taken. When he saw [[Brad Ackles]], his intended victim, outside the hospital, he shot him as well as [[Preston Burke]] before shooting himself in the head in an attempted suicide. He wasn't killed instantly and was taken into the ER to be treated. When Cristina heard that he had shot Burke, she tried to resuscitate him despite the odds, not wanting him to get out of it by dying. He was married, but told Joe he wasn't a good husband. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' He told Joe he wasn't a good father, indicating he has at least one child. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' Petey worked at a restaurant until [[Brad Ackles]] fired him. *Before he started shooting, he had a "distant, hollow look in his eyes" and was "scared, and worried, but resolved", according to a victim.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] {{Scrollbox}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]]

'''Phillip Loomis''' is a patient who was paralyzed in a car accident who was helped by therapeutic hypothermia.


Phillip was in a car accident. The impact crushed his spine and left him paralyzed. Derek said he'd do a spinal decompression, but it was unlikely Phillip would walk again. Owen then suggested therapeutic hypothermia to treat the paralysis.

Callie did research into therapeutic hypothermia and suggested they try it on him. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''

They started the treatment, cooling him down. His heart rate became erratic, so they put him on ECMO and called in Erica. She helped them stabilize him and then they were able to start warming him back up. Afterward, he was able to move his toes. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''



He is married to [[Anna Loomis]].

|first appearance = [[A Hard Day's Night]] |last appearance = [[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Isaiah Washington]]}} {{Quote|I wasn't the most talented student in school. I wasn't the brightest. But I was the best. I practiced.|'''Preston Burke'''}} '''Preston Burke''' is a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]]. He was formerly [[Attending#Department Head|head]] of [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgery]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]], but quit after leaving his fianc\uee, [[Cristina Yang]], during their wedding. After winning a Harper Avery, he founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]], and ran it until he gave it to Cristina. Preston grew up in Alabama, where his mother owns a restaurant. Before going to his high school prom, he was very nervous because he didn't know how to dance. He asked his uncle, who is good at dancing, to help him. His uncle agreed and taught him a few basic moves. He stayed up nights before the prom practicing his dance moves because he wanted to impress his date. On the night of the prom, it all worked out and he didn't step on his date's feet while dancing and she said that he was a wonderful dancer.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] He completed his pre-medical studies at [[Tulane University]] where he pledged Kappa Alpha Psi and went on to graduate first in his class from [[Johns Hopkins Medical School]]. While in college, he met [[Erica Hahn]], who graduated in second place after him, beginning a rivalry between them. When he was at Mercy West fighting for a heart for Denny, he rushed to the hospital to help Denny right away. Then he got shot in the shoulder before entering the hospital. The wound caused damage to the nerves in his arm and caused him to develop a tremor. He took a long time recovering, but he eventually regained use of his arm and hand and he was able to operate again. Preston was in the mood for a traditional, spirited wedding, which rose conflict with Cristina. In the end, they agreed to have a spirited wedding, but only a small one. The news of the wedding was supposed to be secret, but Mark overheard Preston telling Derek, and soon everyone knew. After the wedding, Burke was nowhere to be found. When Cristina asked Derek about him, he told her Burke had handed in a letter of resignation two weeks ago. Preston Burke was one of the and applicants for the [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]]. He was against many applicants, such as [[Erica Hahn]]. He won following his departure from Seattle Grace. Following his [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery]] win, Preston Burke sought out his next challenge. Connecting with a billionaire investor, Preston founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]] in Zurich, Switzerland with a focus on cardiac research. As its [[Chief of Staff|chief medical officer]], Preston managed and worked in the institute for some time until he gave it to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] in order for him to move to Milan, Italy at the request of his wife.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x He is a brilliant surgeon, however, he is sometimes overbearing, especially when it came to his relationship with [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]. He is extremely neat and organized, particularly when it comes to [[Burke's Old Apartment|his apartment]], which is spotless. He is an excellent cook and plays the trumpet. [[Cristina Yang]] At the mixer before the interns' first day, Cristina approached Burke but he ignored her and was too interested in his date. He began a relationship with intern [[Cristina Yang]] but broke it off because he feared it would ruin both of their reputations. However, her miscarriage brought them back together. They lived together in his perfectly-kept apartment. However, after being shot he started to have tremors and they were forced to keep them secret putting a strain on their relationship. After a long time of keeping his tremors a secret, Cristina went to the Chief and confessed everything. Initially, he was engaged in a cold war with Cristina, where neither of them spoke but after she broke the silence, he proposed to her and she accepted. However, on the day of their wedding, Burke told Cristina that he no longer wished to make her do anything against her will, and Burke realized he was trying to make Cristina the woman he wanted her to be rather than accepting her as the woman she is. Cristina said she "thought this was what she wanted." He wanted her to say she ''knew'' it was what she wanted, so he left her in the chapel. Cristina then returned to their apartment and discovered Burke had left, taking with him the things that meant something to only him (his trumpet, his Eugene Foote collection, his grandmother's picture, and his lucky scrub cap), leaving Cristina devastated. He told Derek to inform her he quit and sent his mother to collect his things. Years later, despite having moved on and created a family, Burke evidently still had feelings for Cristina, knowing full-well if he were to work with Cristina again, he would inevitably fall for her again to the point of cheating on his wife with Cristina and ultimately "destroy [his] marriage and [his] life". [[Edra Burke]] Burke is currently married to Edra Burke, with whom he has two children: Simone and Vivianna. Edra has sacrificed her career for their family so Burke could run the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]], but in , Burke gave his job to Cristina so he and Edra could move to Milan in order to be closer to her parents. [[George O'Malley]] Although Burke initially disliked George, he began to like him and later, George became ''his guy''. George even moved in with him for a while but was kicked out when Cristina walked around naked. Burke was friendly towards Derek for a while but he wasn't ''friends'' with him. He even befriended Addison first. After a bomb scare at the hospital they became good friends. He even chose Derek to be his best man. He was good friends with Richard Webber as well. Dr. Preston Burke used to be the [[Attending#Department Head|head]] [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] on a salary of $ million. After completing pre-medical studies at [[Tulane University]], Burke graduated first in his class from [[Johns Hopkins Medical School]]. He completed his [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgical]] [[Fellow|fellowship]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. He was once the interim [[Chief of Surgery|chief of surgery]] while Dr. Webber was healing from brain surgery. He was once shot, affecting his control of his right hand. His temporary fix to this possibly long-term problem was to work together with Cristina during every one of his surgeries so that she could take over in case he might have trouble with his hand. The arrangement fell apart after Cristina, reacting to growing stress after George caught onto their secret, went to the Chief and confessed everything. The chief was quite angry at Burke telling him that many patients are at risk and it is a major problem that his hands are not able to function perfectly. The chief referred to Burke's hands as being worth million dollars. Until their secret was revealed, Burke was set to become the next Chief of Surgery, but now he has to compete with his fellow attendings for the position. He recovered full use of his hand after being operated on by [[Derek Shepherd|Dr. Derek Shepherd]]. [[Image:Preston-burke-wins-award.jpg|left|thumb|px|Burke wins a Harper Avery.]] After he left Cristina at the altar, Preston's long-time rival, [[Erica Hahn|Dr. Erica Hahn]], replaced him as the head of cardiothoracic surgery. She has some respect for Burke, but was infuriated when he won a [[Catherine Fox Award|medical award]] instead of her. Following his [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery]] win, Preston, with the help of a billionaire investor, founded the [[Klausman Institute for Medical Research]] in Zurich, Switzerland with a focus on cardiac research. As its [[Chief of Staff|chief medical officer]], Preston managed and worked in the institute for some time until he gave it to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] in order for him to move to Milan, Italy at the request of his wife.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x *Cristina rarely called Burke by his first name, Preston. *He learned to cook because his mother owned a restaurant in Alabama. *He plays the trumpet and enjoys jazz music, especially [[Eugene Foote|Eugene Foote's]]. He performed surgery to remove the pacemaker on his musical hero at Foote's request, but against Burke's better judgment. Unfortunately, Foote died during surgery.[[Blues for Sister Someone]], x *Burke was the only cardiothoracic [[Transplant Surgery|transplant specialist]] at Seattle Grace[[ Seconds]], x, a role presumably taken over by [[Erica Hahn|Dr. Hahn]] upon on his departure. *When casting for Burke, he was described as a nebbishy, stout forty-something man. *In the alternate reality episode [[If/Then]], Preston Burke is one of the missing characters, though it is explained that he had a romantic relationship with [[Cristina Yang]] and abruptly left the hospital shortly after. *Burke believes his scrub caps are lucky and he feels nervous about surgery without them. *During season one, despite being a cardiothoracic surgeon, Burke oversaw, and ultimately performed, an appendectomy. Additionally, he was planned to perform a Whipple. Both procedures are typically performed by a general surgeon, however Burke is likely to have been certified in general surgery before completing his cardiothoracic fellowship. *In , Preston Burke was a [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic]] [[Fellow|surgical fellow]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].[[Shake Your Groove Thing]], x *In the season seven episode [[Shock to the System]], a former patient of Burke is hospitalized. Teddy Altman is rather critical of Burke's approach to her treatment, calling it 'conservative' and proposes a radically new procedure. It should be noted though that years had passed since Burke last treated the patient, so Teddy's approach may have been unknown to Burke back then. *He is said to make great paella, a rice dish.[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]] *He loves to watch the rain.[[Six Days, Part ]], x *He had the lowest mortality rate while at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *Burke does not eat red meat.[[Let It Be]], x *Burke is a Gemini.[[The Becoming]], x PrestonBurke.png PrestonBurke.png PrestonBurke.png xPrestonBurke.png {{GalleryLink}} These episodes are Burke-centric or otherwise very informative about his life. *[[Who's Zoomin' Who?]] *[[Deterioration of the Fight or Flight Response]] *[[Losing My Religion]] *[[I Am a Tree]] *[[Didn't We Almost Have It All?]] *[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]] :'''Preston:''' Cristina, I could promise to hold you and to cherish you. I could promise to be there in sickness and in health. I could say till death do us part, but I won't. Those vows are for optimistic couples, ones full of hope. And I do not stand here on my wedding day optimistic or full of hope. I am not optimistic, I am not hopeful, I am sure, I am steady, and I know that I am a heart man. Taken apart, put back together, I hold them in my hands. I am a heart man. So this I am sure, you are my partner, my lover, my very best friend. My heart, my heart beats for you and on this day, the day of our wedding, I promise you this, I promise you to lay my heart in the palm of your hands. I promise you me.[[Didn't We Almost Have It All?]], x ---- :'''Preston''' '''(to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]):''' I am Preston Burke. A widely renowned [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic]] surgeon. I am a professional and more than that I am a good and kind person. I am a person that cleans up behind myself. I am a person that cooks well. And you, you are an unbelievable slob, a slovenly, angry intern. I am Preston Burke and you, you are the most competitive, most guarded, most stubborn, most challenging person I have ever met and I love you. What the hell is the matter with you that you won't just let me?[[Yesterday]], x ---- :'''Preston''' '''(to [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]]):''' The way I loved you, was consuming.[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]], x {{Preston Burke Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[de:Preston Burke]] [[fr:Preston Burke]] [[es:Preston Burke]] [[it:Preston Burke]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Burke, Preston}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]] [[Category:Patients (Clinic)]]

'''Pruitt Byrd''' is a patient with a cardiac tumor who needed a "Humpty-Dumpty" surgery.


Pruitt had been diagnosed with a primary cardiac tumor and was sent to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] to see [[Preston Burke]]. He and his wife were told he needed a cardiac auto-transplantation.

Pruitt was taken into surgery to have the tumor removed and it went very well.



He is married to [[Estelle Byrd]].

{{Attending Infobox |image = xRajSen.png |name = Raj Sen |status = Alive |title = M.D. |job = [[Attending]] [[Psychiatry|Psychiatrist]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[The First Cut Is the Deepest]] |last appearance = [[Back Where You Belong]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Anjul Nigam]] }} '''Raj Sen''' is a [[Psychiatry|psychiatrist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. Raj was one of the doctors who saw [[Meredith's Roommate Notice|Meredith's roommate notice]] and tried to move in with her. She declined when their music interests clashed. ''("[[The First Cut Is the Deepest]]")'' Raj brought [[Mr. Duff]] to the surgeons, saying Mr. Duff was his gift to them. He'd had two seizures since being admitted to the psychiatric ward and had to be cleared before he could be returned. ''("[[Save Me]]")'' Raj consulted on [[R. Hubble|Mr. Hubble's]] case after he swallowed Judy doll heads. He suggested that he might idolize the dolls as partners or he planned to derive sexual pleasure from passing them. ''("[[Enough is Enough]]")'' Shane Herman came in with what was believed to be a male hysterical pregnancy. He was then stolen by surgical interns, who believed it was a surgical case. Meredith had to distract Raj while they stole his chart because they hadn't taken it when the took Shane himself. Raj later came to where they had taken Shane and fought with them over whether he was a psych patient or a surgical patient. Surgery ultimately won. ''("[[Something to Talk About]]")'' After the doctors discovered that Bex Singleton was intersex, they consulted with psych and Raj told Bex's parents that most intersex individuals start to identify very strongly with one sex and it's not always the one they've been raised. ''("[[Begin the Begin]]")'' He was called in to consult on Jesse Fannon, who had OCD that caused a car accident. He explained Jesse's condition to Cristina. ''("[[Superstition]]")'' When James Miller came into the clinic claiming that his foot was not part of his body, Raj said he had body dysmorphic disorder and suggested that Bailey prescribe anti-anxiety drugs to lessen the urgency. ''("[[Haunt You Every Day]]")'' When Claire Nolan came into the ER, confused and seeming delusional, Raj examined her and tentatively diagnosed her with schizophrenia. When her parents arrived at the hospital, information her mother gave supported that diagnosis. He said they'd stabilize her with haloperidol and then there were other medications they could try. He also offered support programs to her family to help them. ''("[[Back Where You Belong]]")'' Dr. Raj Sen is a [[Psychiatry|psychiatrist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. He provides psych consults for the doctors relating to patients with apparent psychiatric issues and sometimes is fodder for conflict with the regulars. He once fought with [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]], [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie]], and [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] over a male patient who declared himself pregnant and another time an elderly woman was thrust upon him by [[George O'Malley|George]]. *His favorite ''s band is ''Twisted Sister''.[[The First Cut Is the Deepest]], x *In his [[The First Cut Is the Deepest|first appearance]], Raj was wearing scrubs normally associated with [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|interns]] and [[Resident|residents]] and carrying x-ray films, but by his second episode, Raj was explicitly stated to be one of the [[Psychiatry|psych interns]] wearing scrubs of that department. It is unclear if this was a show error or if Raj was among one of the surgical interns that would transfer to an "easier specialty" which [[Richard Webber|Richard]] mentioned during the [[A Hard Day's Night|pilot]]. '''Rebecca Froy''' is a doctor who signed an NDA after a lawsuit involving [[Harper Avery]].


Rebecca was doing ultrasound tumor removal research and Amelia hoped she was further along in her research so they could use her knowledge for [[Kimmie Park]]. Rebecca was happy to help and suggested she could stay a few extra days after coming to Washington to give a presentation, but she abruptly backed out when she heard GSM was a Harper Avery hospital. Amelia tried to get to her elaborate, but she just hung up. Jackson spoke to her and said his grandfather was dead and asked her to reconsider, but she said she'd signed an NDA and hung up on him. Jackson then decided to go to the legal team and have them waive the NDA that was blocking her, believing it was just a spat over some research.


She is a neuroscientist at The Neuro Institute in Chicago. She is doing research into using ultrasound waves to remove tumors.


*She knows [[Tom Koracick]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Froy, Rebecca}}

'''Rebecca "Bex" Singleton''' is a patient who came in with a hormonal imbalance and was found to have a tumor.


Bex had an enlarged pelvic lymph node that they had to biopsy. Before the biopsy, they ran labs that Bex had unbalanced hormone levels, indicating the use of birth control pills. George asked Bex about it and Bex said they were trying to make their breasts grow.

Addison took Bex for the biopsy, but they discovered that the tumor was compressing what they believed was an ovary. The pathology report revealed that it was actually a testes, meaning Bex is intersex. They talked to Bex's parents and called for a psych consult. The parents were told that physically, Bex would be fine as the tumor was benign, but the doctors encouraged the whole family to get therapy.

Bex's parents came to Addison and said they didn't want to tell Bex and asked Addison to remove the male sex organs when she went in to remove the tumor. Addison declined and said they'd have a hard time finding a doctor who would agree to it.

Before Bex's surgery, unable to lie, George forced Bex's parents to tell them about their condition. Bex's parents were upset and George was taken off the case, but he later went to check on Bex and said they didn't have to be a boy, but they could if they wanted to. He then started to cut Bex's hair at Bex's request. Bex's parents came in and their mother took over the haircut.



Bex's parents were unable to help when they struggled with depression in middle school. When they found out Bex was intersex, they tried to have Bex's male sex organs removed and didn't plan to tell Bex about it. However, after George started to cut Bex's hair, Bex's mother stepped in and finished.


Bex had a best friend named Jen who stopped hanging out with them when she became interested in boys.


*Bex likes to draw comics.
*Bex cut themselves.
*Bex was  at the time of their hospitalization.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Singleton, Rebecca}}

'''Robert Bonocore''' is a\ua[[Neurosurgery|neurosurgeon]]\uaat the\ua[[Cleveland Clinic]].



Due to his work regarding an epilepsy neurostimulator, Robert received a nomination for the  Harper Avery Award.

At the party before the award ceremony, Robert met\ua[[Cristina Yang]]. After introducing himself,\uahe told her he was a huge fan and that he read all her work on her conduit research. He found it fascinating. They were joined by another doctor who was also fond of Cristina's work. Robert and the doctor kept asking questions to a distracted Cristina. Robert was primarly fascinated that she was nominated for a Harper Avery Award so early in her career, as she was still only a [[Fellow|fellow]]. Their conversation was interrupted by the buzzer that informed them that they could all go to their table in the room where the award would be handed out.

Unfortunately, Robert did not win the Award.



He was a huge fan of\ua[[Cristina Yang]], who was nominated for a Harper Avery in the same year as he was,\uaand was fascinated by her work regarding conduits. He read all about it and he told her about this.


Dr. Robert Bonocore is a neurosurgeon at the Cleveland Clinic. In , he was nominated for an Harper Avery Award for his work with an epilepsy neurostimulator.


*Due to his brain mapping project, Derek referred three patients in one week to the Cleveland Clinic. It's possible they came under the Robert's care.

'''Ruthie Carlin''' is a patient who came in to have a valve replaced and had trouble deciding which kind of valve to get.


Ruthie was in the hospital for a valve replacement. She originally planned to get a mechanical valve, but when she heard about the clicking noise it made, she reconsidered and thought she might want a porcine valve instead.

After her sister ate a pork chop, she said that she didn't feel kinship with the pig and wondered if the bovine valve might be better. She asked if she could see the valves and make her decision that way. She said neither one was speaking to her, so Cristina said she just had to make a decision. She chose pig.

In surgery, there was unexpected bleeding, but Teddy told Cristina she could handle it and didn't step in to help. Cristina eventually made the decision of what to do. She was able to save Ruthie and finish the surgery.



She has a sister. She also has a cousin whose wife is a cardiologist.


*She's allergic to aspirin, ibuprofen, bananas, zucchini, squash, latex, and dust mites.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Carlin, Ruthie}}

'''Sam Friedman''' is the father of [[Devo Friedman]].


Sam's daughter, Devo, had a root canal and couldn't stop bleeding afterward, so she was taken to the hospital. At the hospital, they detected a heart murmur. She needed a heart valve replacement. She was diagnosed with Von Willebrand disease, which made her ineligible for a mechanical heart valve. Her religious beliefs prevented her from accepting a porcine valve, so she challenged the doctors to come up with another possible solution. After some research, Alex determined that she could get a bovine valve instead, which was even better because it would last longer. Burke was reluctant to do the procedure as he hadn't done it before, but he ultimately agreed to do it. During the procedure, he consulted with [[Dr. Chesney]], who had done the procedure before.



He is married to [[Doris Friedman]]. Together, they have a daughter.


He has one daughter named Devo.


*He likes hospital food.
*He and his wife practice reform Judaism.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Friedman, Sam}}

'''Sarabeth Breyers''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. She sustained no serious injuries.


While on the way to the Fire and Ice Ball, Sarabeth, [[Betty Kenner|Betty]], and [[Anna Loomis|Anna]] were in a car accident. Sarabeth drove them to the hospital in the wrecked limo after they extracted their driver from the window.

When they arrived at the hospital, Sarabeth had a cut on her face and a bruised arm, but was otherwise okay. She insisted on having a plastic surgeon stitch her face, which Mark did.

When they heard that their husbands were being taken to Mercy West, they insisted that they be brought to Seattle Grace instead.

Sarabeth's husband, Michael, was brought into the ER with a pen in his throat to help him breathe. She later found out that his vocal cords were severed and he was unable to speak. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''

After hearing that her husband was cheating on her, she became angry at him. However, she later forgave him. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''



[[Michael Breyers]]
The girls described themselves as the happiest married people alive (except when their husbands smoked). Sarabeth's husband started cheating on her with her friend Anna when he lost his job, but when Anna came clean, she soon forgave them both.


Her best friends in life were Anna Loomis and [[Betty Kenner]]. She and Anna had known each other since they were little kids.

'''Sean Brotherton''' is the husband of [[Teresa Brotherton]] and father of [[Keisha Brotherton]].


Sean came to the hospital after his wife fell down the stairs holding their baby. He was primarily worried about his wife and told the doctors to do whatever they needed with their baby. They'd only just adopted her and Sean didn't feel like he had bonded with her very well. She hadn't even been named yet because they wanted to get to know her first.

When it started to look like his wife wouldn't make it, he wanted to know who to call because he didn't think he could raise the baby on his own. While Teresa was having surgery, Meredith came out to give him an update and said that some people bond instantly and others take a while to feel like a family. He might know his daughter more than he thinks. He listed off all the things he knows about her. Meredith says that's five things he knows that no one else does.

When the doctors informed him that Teresa had died, he decided to keep the baby. He named her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.



He was married to [[Teresa Brotherton]] until her death.


He and Teresa adopted a baby girl. They didn't name her right away because they wanted to get to know her first. Teresa bonded with the baby right away, but Sean didn't. He briefly considered giving her back when it looked like his wife was going to die, but after she died, he decided to keep her and name her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.


He is a plumber for Plumbing Service and Repair.

'''Shane Herman''' is a man who was admitted to psych because he believed he was pregnant.


While his wife, Tina, was pregnant, Shane jokingly took a pregnancy test. They were both shocked when it came back positive. Then Shane's abdomen started to grow right along with Tina's. Shane was admitted to the hospital's psych ward after he freaked out about being pregnant because they believed it was all in his head, but a few of the surgical interns stole him and began investigating the actual cause of his large abdomen. They could feel a solid mass in his abdomen, indicating that it wasn't a hysterical male pregnancy. After running tests, the doctors diagnosed a mesenteric teratoma, a potentially malignant mass. The case drew extensive attention, with doctors paying money for spots in the room. The attention made the Hermans nervous. Meredith eventually stepped in and forced everyone to leave the room and give the Hermans their privacy. Shane was taken into surgery to remove the mass. After it was removed, Meredith took the mass to dispose of it, as she had promise the Hermans she would so it wouldn't be put on display in a jar.



He is married to [[Tina Herman]].


He and his wife are expecting their first child.

'''Sonya Cowlman''' came into the hospital after getting caught on her ex-husband's penis piercing while they were having sex.


Sonya and her ex-husband, Adam, were having a secret affair. While they were having sex, her IUD became caught on his new penis piercing and they became stuck together. They used x-ray imaging to see how they were hooked and they manually separated them. Just as they were separated, Adam had a heart attack and his aorta dissected.

Sonya was told afterward to use a back-up birth control method as her IUD had to be removed. She said she doubted she'd be having sex anytime soon because she was going to tell her husband about her affair with Adam.



[[Adam Morris]]
She and Adam Morris were married for  years and had one daughter, Jennifer. They divorced, but five years later, they were still sleeping together when they met up at events. During one encounter, they got stuck together and had to go to the hospital to be separate. Sonya decided that that would be their final encounter and she was going to come clean to her husband. She said that the first time it happened, she felt guilty, but it kept happening and she stopped feeling guilty.

Tom Cowlman
After divorcing Adam, Sonya married Tom. Despite this, she continued to sleep with Adam occasionally. After they were hospitalized for getting stuck together during sex, Sonya decided that she had to tell Tom about Adam.


She has one daughter with her first husband, Adam. According to her, Adam coddles her.


She sells real estate.

'''Speed''' is a patient who collapsed in a restaurant with an aortic dissection.



Speed's wife, Talia, contracted food poisoning and went to the hospital with Speed. She was treated and on her way out, she and Speed wondered where billing was. [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] and [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]] informed them that it's in the basement.


Later, while dining at a restaurant, Speed collapsed to the floor and Talia desperately called out for a doctor. [[Preston Burke|Burke]] and [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]], who were dining at a nearby table, rushed over to help. Once they got to him, they noticed the signs of Marfan syndrome and suspected an aortic dissection, a common condition among people with Marfan syndrome. They called an ambulance and had him rushed over to the hospital, where they operated and were able to save his life. After his surgery, his wife was told he'd be okay.



He's married to [[Talia (Let It Be)|Talia]].

'''Stanley Singer''' is a football coach and father of [[Adam Singer]].


Stanley brought his son to Seattle Grace after his son was hurt playing football. He was charging a receiver after kick-off but got blocked and his head held down. As a result, he couldn't see another guy coming and was hit. Stanley insisted that his son could have gotten past it.

When [[Cristina Yang]] applied weights to realign Adam's spine, Stanley tried to encourage his son by yelling that he could take the pain and that if he didn't take the pain he would be paralyzed. Adam became stressed and yelled at his father to get out.

After a successful surgery, Cristina Yang saw Stanley stroke Adam's hair apologetically.



Stanley has one son, [[Adam Singer]]. Because he was also his son's coach, he often pushed him too hard.


Stanley works as a football coach.

{{Patient Infobox |image = StephanieDrake.png |name = Stephanie Drake |status = Alive |diagnosis = *Emphysema *Hyper-inflated lungs |doctors = *[[Preston Burke]] *John Davies *Craig Lawson *Angela Whiting ---- *[[Richard Webber]] *[[Miranda Bailey]] *[[George O'Malley]] |treatment = Surgery |job = '''Former'''
Waitress |only appearance = [[Shake Your Groove Thing]] |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Kathryn Joosten]] }} '''Stephanie Drake''' is a former chronic smoker who was treated twice, on separate occasions, at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. Five years from her second operation at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]], Stephanie Drake was diagnosed with emphysema due to her four-pack-a-day smoking habit. In order to relieve the pressure in her chest and to improve her quality of life, Mrs. Drake was admitted to Seattle Grace under the care of Dr. John Davies, an attending cardiothoracic surgeon, and his surgical fellow at the time, [[Preston Burke|Dr. Preston Burke]]. During the operation, Dr. Davies performed a left upper lobectomy on Mrs. Drake lungs. After Dr. Davies finished, Dr. Burke finished by performing the close. Unfortunately, Dr. Burke had erroneously left a surgical towel within Mrs. Drake's thoracic cavity. The incident went unreported as Dr. Burke feared that it would cause irreparable damage to his cardiothoracic surgical career. Soon after, Mrs. Drake overcame her habit and quit smoking cold-turkey. However, in the next five years, she still suffered discomfort and had to resign from her restaurant job. Mrs. Drake returned to Seattle Grace Hospital five years later to surgically relieve the pressure in her lungs. She was assigned to [[Resident|resident surgeons]] [[Miranda Bailey]] and [[George O'Malley]], who was a [[Internship|surgical intern]] at the time, and [[Attending|attending surgeon]] and [[Chief of Surgery]] [[Richard Webber]]. After a chest x-ray, Mrs. Drake was diagnosed with hyper-inflated lungs caused by, what they thought, was bullae. Dr. Webber noted this was her second visit and advised both Dr. Bailey and Dr. O'Malley to refrain from the anti-smoking lecture. However, during Mrs. Drake pre-operative prep, Dr. O'Malley mentioned to her that it would have been a good idea to stop smoking. Mrs. Drake then informed Dr. O'Malley that she did indeed quit, but the discomfort continued. It was this conversation that Mrs. Drake became fond of Dr. O'Malley. During her laprascopic procedure, both Dr. Webber and Dr. Bailey discovered the surgical towel in an attempt to cut the bullae, and immediately converted to an open thoracotomy to extract the towel. Once removed, Dr. Webber assumed that the towel came from her initial surgery at Seattle Grace. Dr. Webber soon tasked Dr. Bailey to spearhead the investigation as to how this could have occurred, while he had the conversation with Mrs. Drake regarding her post-operative condition. Dr. Bailey assigned fellow surgical intern [[Cristina Yang]] to look into the post-operative reports to identify the doctors involved with the initial surgery. Given Mrs. Drake fondness of Dr. O'Malley, Dr. Bailey assigned him to pacify Mrs. Drake to mitigate the potential lawsuit. Dr. Yang soon discovered that Dr. Burke was the surgical fellow assigned to the case at the time and had performed the closing procedure. She immediately shared these results with Dr. Bailey, who then approached Dr. Burke about this matter. During an unrelated case, Dr. Burke admitted to his carelessness to Chief Webber and the hospital's legal counsel and then personally apologized to Mrs. Drake. *According to [[Richard Webber]], Mrs. Drake was treated at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] in ; however, when Cristina examines the post-operative report from Mrs. Drake's surgery, the date shown is --. *Although her first procedure was performed by [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeons]], Mrs. Drake's second procedure, still involving the thoracic region of the body, was performed by [[Richard Webber|Dr. Webber]] and [[Miranda Bailey|Dr. Bailey]], both of whom are [[General Surgery|general surgeons]]. *One of her original doctors was named [[Angela Whiting]], the same as the show's property master. {{DEFAULTSORT:Drake, Stephanie}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (Cardio)]] [[Category:Patients (General)]]

'''Steve Beck''' is a patient who dislocated his knee while running a marathon.


Steve was running a marathon when he passed out, fell, and dislocated his patella. [[Callie Torres]] reduced his knee and ordered post-reduction films and labs.

The labs showed that he was severely dehydrated, so they gave him fluids to re-hydrate him. He mentioned that his knee and calves were sore. Cristina examined them and saw extremely swelling. Callie and Cristina did bilateral fasciotomies to relieve the pressure. His kidneys were failing. Callie put together that the aspirin he'd taken that morning for the cold he had had progressed his symptoms. [[Richard Webber]] placed a dialysis catheter and ordered dialysis to pull the toxins out of his blood.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He's won two marathons.

'''Steve Murphy''' was one of Meredith's one-night stands who came into the hospital with priapism.



Steve met Meredith at [[Emerald City Bar]] and she took him home. They had sex, after which he asked her if she'd had an orgasm. The next morning, Meredith left to take a shower and said he needed to leave before she was finished. He got dressed and left in a hurry.


Steve later came into the hospital still erect. He was shocked to see Meredith there and she was shocked to see him. Cristina did an enema, but it didn't work. They next went to needle aspiration, which worked for a while, but he soon became erect again, so they started looking for other causes. They called for a neuro consult and Derek diagnosed a tumor in his spine which was pushing on a nerve and causing the erection. Derek planned surgery to remove the tumor. The surgery was successful and Steve was happily flaccid afterward.



He had a one-night stand with Meredith.


He asked Meredith to call his mother when he had to have surgery.

'''Teresa Brotherton''' came into the hospital after falling down the stairs while holding her newborn.


Teresa walked into the ER holding her baby. She was upset because she had fallen down the stairs while holding her and was worried she was seriously injured. She passed her baby over to the doctors. Shortly thereafter, she collapsed. She had no pulse. In the ER, [[Cristina Yang]] relieved a tension pneumothorax and then [[Erica Hahn]] took over and took Teresa for a CT. Teresa has multiple broken ribs and a hemothorax, so she was taken into surgery. She survived the surgery and then made it through the night.

In the morning, Lexie brought the baby in to see them, but Teresa's heart stopped and the baby was sent back while they got her heart started again. Her other lung was leaking, but they couldn't operate because her heart couldn't take the strain.

Knowing she wouldn't make it another day without surgery, they put her on a heart-lung machine in her room so she could be transported to the OR for surgery. They found a hole in her remaining lung and patched it. They were hoping it would hold and that was the only tear. When they checked, they found another leak. They tried to repair the damage, but they were unable to and Teresa died in the OR.



She was married to [[Sean Brotherton]] until her death.


She and Sean adopted a baby girl. They didn't name her right away because they wanted to get to know her first. Teresa bonded with the baby right away, but Sean didn't. He briefly considered giving her back when it looked like his wife was going to die, but after she died, he decided to keep her and name her Keisha because that's what Teresa wanted to name her.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Brotherton, Teresa}}

'''Todd''' is a man with a pituitary tumor Amelia diagnosed while they were having sex.


While flying from Los Angeles to Seattle, Todd met [[Amelia Shepherd]]. While they were hooking up, she noticed that he had spongy hands and told him he probably had a pituitary tumor. She brought him to the hospital with her, where she intended him as a present for her brother, [[Derek Shepherd]].

At the hospital, they did a workup and found the tumor. They took him into surgery to remove it. The surgery was successful.



He hooked up with [[Amelia Shepherd]] on a plane from Los Angeles to Seattle.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Todd}}

'''Tony Savitch''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] who was admitted for bypass surgery on his heart.


Tony was admitted to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] for heart surgery. He was nervous about the surgery and not eager about the lifestyle changes he needed to make afterward. George comforted him and his wife by saying it was a very routine procedure and that Tony would be fine. He then promised them he'd be okay.

While drawing pre-op labs, George had to stick Tony multiple times before Burke ultimately took over and drew the blood himself.

Burke took him into surgery, where there were complications that resulted in his death. When Burke heard what George had said, he made George tell the family about Tony's death.



He was married to [[Gloria Savitch]] until his death and they had four daughters.


*His room was decorated with children's drawings, presumably drawn by his daughters.
*He has the distinction of being the first person to die on ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]''.

'''Tyler Lee''' is a kid who came in with kidney stones, but his procedure was cancelled when it looked like he passed the stones on his own.


Tyler had come into the hospital with renal colic three days prior. They planned shock wave lithotripsy to break up the stones in his ureter so they could pass, but his urine had no blood in it the previous night, so his procedure was cancelled as they believed the stones had passed on their own. He was excited to get to eat.



Tyler's mother came to the hospital with him. When they learned he wouldn't need surgery, she was relieved.


*He was nine at the time of his hospitalization.
*He likes chocolate pudding.

'''Vincent Kenner''' is a man who came into the hospital after a limo crash.


Vincent, plus his friends [[Phillip Loomis]] and [[Michael Breyers]], were in a limo on the way to a ball when the limo hit a patch of ice and they were injured. Vincent was taken to the ER, where despite his injuries making survival unlikely, they took him into surgery. In surgery, he had a tear in his renal artery. Webber had Cristina stitch the tear, but because she was used to doing the stitch on the more sturdy tissue of the heart, the stitch didn't hold and his bowel tore. They were able to close and move him to the ICU, where he was stable, but still in critical condition. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''

In the ICU, he coded and was unable to be revived. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''



He was married to [[Betty Kenner]] until his death. She was in an accident the same day as he was, which left her unable to form new memories, including the knowledge that her husband had died.


He was friends with [[Phillip Loomis]] and [[Michael Breyers]].


*He was  at the time of his death. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")''

'''Wade Solomon''' is the husband of [[Claire Solomon]].


While on their honeymoon, Wade's wife, Claire, ended up in the ER with a rash on her leg that was spreading quickly. They marked the rash to track the spread. It crossed the line within a few minutes of being marked, informing them that it was extremely aggressive. When asked about it, Wade said she'd cut her foot on some oyster shells a few days ago while windsurfing in Puget Sound. They took her in to remove the infection, but the lab results showed that it was necrotizing fasciitis. They spoke to Wade and said that amputation was the safest option, but Sydney believed they could cut out the infection and try to keep the leg functional.

Sydney cut out every piece of necrotic tissue she could and said that she believed Claire would be okay after a few runs in a hyperbaric chamber.



He is newly married to [[Claire Solomon]]. After their wedding, they planned an adventure honeymoon that included mountain climbing, windsurfing, and running a K.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Solomon, Wade}}

'''Walter Tapley''' is a doctor who was admitted to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] for heart surgery.


Tapley admitted himself to SGH, asking [[Richard Webber|Richard]]\uato\uahave [[Erica Hahn]] perform an extremely risky surgery (double valve replacement and tricuspid repair) on his heart.

The Chief had to agree as Walter Tapley made his career, but Erica was unwilling to do it. Eventually, she agreed to perform the surgery and it was completed successfully.

With [[George O'Malley|George]] as his doctor, he noticed his fine work, when George asked him if he could talk to the chief about him, he said no, but secretly did anyway.



Walter Tapley mentored [[Richard Webber]].


Walter Tapley is a world-famous [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]] and old mentor of [[Richard Webber]].


*He spent six years developing a modified bypass procedure.

'''Will''' was shot when [[Petey]] started firing a gun in a restaurant.


Will was working at a restaurant when he was shot in the leg. He was taken to the ER, where they assessed his leg. He had a bullet lodged in his tibia.

While Will was waiting for an OR, he became annoyed at [[Brad Ackles]] talking about how he had it better than the rest of them. His surgery was delayed because there were no available ORs. They said they'd get him in as soon as they could.



Will has a good relationship with his co-worker, [[Kendra Thomas]]. He says she'll cover shifts when you need her to, she's good with the customers, and she tips the busboys well. When he learned that she had died, he was very upset.


He's a busboy at a restaurant. He was saving up to go back to school.

They then came to the hospital with him, though they continued to make fun of him. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

They stayed at the hospital and because of their influence, Lola refused to go see Andrew before his surgery. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

'''Will Noonan''' is the husband of [[Katy Noonan]], who had heart surgery at [[Mayo Clinic]].



Will and his wife Katy are doomsday preppers, but they're prepping for things like Ozone depletion. They have a seed bank and several "bug-out" bags.


Scans revealed that Katy had a very large aneurysm that had formed because of a congenital heart defect. Two surgeries were planned: the first to fix the aneurysm and the second to repair the defect so another aneurysm wouldn't form.

In her first surgery, her aneurysm burst, but they were able to save her and repair the problem. After surgery, they had to wait until she woke up to see if she'd have lasting damage.

She woke up the next morning and they planned to proceed with the second surgery. When Will vocalized some concerns about the second surgery, Katy reminded them that they take action.

In surgery, Dr. Thomas had a heart attack and died. Despite this, Cristina was able to complete the surgery successfully.



He is married to [[Katy Noonan]]. They met in a workshop on making "bug-out" bags.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Noonan, Katy}}

'''Yumi Miyazaki''' is a competitive eater who came into the hospital with persistent hiccups.


Yumi came into the ER with persistent hiccups that had started a few days before. They gave her chlorpromazine, which stopped them for a while, but they came back. The doctors scheduled an esophogram, but her coach, [[Kamaji]], tried to get them to give her more of the medicine in order to stop the hiccups, so she could compete in her last competition for a while, a suggestion that was quickly dismissed.

The esophogram revealed a tear in her esophagus, probably caused by her competitive eating. She needed surgery to repair it and Bailey suggested that she give up competitive eating. When Kamaji asked for privacy to break the news to Yumi, Bailey stepped out and asked Alex to get a translator to make sure Yumi was getting the facts.

When the translator arrived, Yumi wasn't in her room and [[Nurse Kate]] informed Alex that she'd left with Kamaji.

Yumi went to compete at The Taste of Seattle, but she was brought back to the ER vomiting up blood. They rushed her into surgery to repair her esophagus.

After her surgery, she was awake and stable. Kamaji came into her room and apologized to her for ending her career.



She came into the ER with her coach, [[Kamaji]]. When he lied to her about the severity of her condition, she ended up back in the hospital in worse condition.


Yumi is a competitive eater. She's successful enough to be recognized by sports fans.


*She doesn't speak English.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Miyazaki, Yumi}}
